newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico stocks seen buoyant, peso slightly weak.
newsitem.headline: Mexico stocks seen buoyant, peso slightly weak.

text.p: -Mexico stocks viewed slightly up at open
-Peso expected weak on month-end dollar demand
-Cetes overnight rate seen nervous on seasonal pressures
The Mexican bourse was expected to open lightly up on Friday because of left-over buy orders from Thursday's close, traders said.
"The market should open up, we expect less activity (during the day)," one dealer said.
He added that the upcoming Federal Reserve Open Market Committee on July 2 and the U.S. July 4 holiday were keeping many players out of the market.
Technical analysts situated support at 4,400 points on the IPC index, compared to Thursday's close of 4,464.98 points.
The peso was seen opening on the weak side, because of end of the month and end of the week demand for dollars.
The spot, or 48-hour peso, was expected to trade between 7.95 and 7.97 pesos per dollar. Pre-open bids stood at 7.9540/7.9580 per dollar, compared to Thursday's close of 7.9500/7.9555.
The overnight Cetes rate was expected to rise as big buyers held back from the market.
The overnight interest rate could close at between 21 and 22 percent, dealers said.
